001package io.jstach.jstachio;
002
003import java.io.IOException;
004import java.io.OutputStream;
005import java.util.NoSuchElementException;
006import java.util.ServiceLoader;
007import java.util.function.Supplier;
008
009import io.jstach.jstache.JStache;
010import io.jstach.jstachio.spi.AbstractJStachio;
011import io.jstach.jstachio.spi.JStachioConfig;
012import io.jstach.jstachio.spi.JStachioExtension;
013import io.jstach.jstachio.spi.JStachioFactory;
014
015/**
016 * Render models by using reflection or static catalog to lookup generated templates as
017 * well as apply filtering and fallback mechanisms.
018 * <h2>Example Usage</h2> <pre><code class="language-java">
019 * &#64;JStache(template = "Hello {{name}}!")
020 * public record HelloWorld(String name) {}
021 *
022 * public static String output(String name) {
023 *   //Normally you would have to use generated class HelloWorldRenderer
024 *   //but this JStachio allows you to render directly
025 *   //from the model.
026 *   return JStachio.render(new HelloWorld(name));
027 * }
028 * </code> </pre> Not only is the above more convenient than using the raw generated code
029 * it also allows additional custom runtime behavior like filtering as well as allows
030 * easier integration with web frameworks.
031 *
032 * <h2>Customize</h2>
033 *
034 * The default {@link JStachio} uses the {@link ServiceLoader} to load
035 * {@link JStachioExtension}s. You can customize it by adding jars that have provided
036 * {@link JStachioExtension}s or by {@linkplain JStachioConfig adjusting config}.
037 *
038 * <p>
039 *
040 * If you would like to create your own {@link JStachio} instead of the default you can
041 * either extend {@link AbstractJStachio} or use {@link JStachioFactory#builder()}. If you
042 * want your custom {@link JStachio} to be set as the default such that the static render
043 * methods on this class call it you can do that with {@link #setStatic(Supplier)}.
044 *
045 * @apiNote The static <strong><code>render</code></strong> methods are convenience
046 * methods that will by default use the ServiceLoader based JStachio which loads all
047 * extensions via the {@link ServiceLoader}.
048 * @see JStachioExtension
049 * @see JStache
050 * @see JStachioFactory#builder()
051 */
052public interface JStachio extends Renderer<Object> {
053
054        /**
055         * Finds a template by using the models class if possible and then applies filtering
056         * and then finally render the model by writing to the appendable.
057         * <p>
058         * {@inheritDoc}
059         */
060        void execute(Object model, Appendable appendable) throws IOException;
061
062        /**
063         * Finds a template by using the models class if possible and then applies filtering
064         * and then finally render the model by writing to the {@link StringBuilder}.
065         * <p>
066         * {@inheritDoc}
067         */
068        StringBuilder execute(Object model, StringBuilder sb);
069
070        /**
071         * Finds a template by using the models class if possible and then applies filtering
072         * and then finally render the model to a String.
073         * <p>
074         * {@inheritDoc}
075         */
076        String execute(Object model);
077
078        /**
079         * Finds a template by class. This is useful if you want to have the template write
080         * directly to an {@link OutputStream} via
081         * {@link Template#write(Object, OutputStream)} which will possibly leverage
082         * pre-encoding and need metadata before writing such as charset and media type for
083         * HTTP output.
084         * <p>
085         * The returned template is decorated if filtering is on and a filter that is not the
086         * template is applied.
087         * @param model the model
088         * @return a filtered template
089         * @throws NoSuchElementException if a template is not found and no other lookup
090         * errors happen.
091         * @throws Exception if template cannot be found for unexpected reasons such as
092         * reflection errors.
093         */
094        Template<?> findTemplate(Object model) throws Exception;
095
096        /**
097         * Determines if this jstachio can render the model type (the class annotated by
098         * JStache).
099         * @param modelType the models class (<em>the one annotated with {@link JStache} and
100         * not the Templates class</em>)
101         * @return true if this jstachio can render instances of modelType
102         */
103        boolean supportsType(Class<?> modelType);
104
105        /**
106         * Executes the ServiceLoader instance of JStachio
107         * {@link #execute(Object, Appendable)}.
108         * @param model never <code>null</code>
109         * @param a appendable never <code>null</code>
110         * @throws IOException if there is an error using the appendable
111         * @see #execute(Object, Appendable)
112         */
113        public static void render(Object model, Appendable a) throws IOException {
114                of().execute(model, a);
115        }
116
117        /**
118         * Executes the ServiceLoader instance of JStachio
119         * {@link #execute(Object, StringBuilder)}.
120         * @param model never <code>null</code>
121         * @param a appendable never <code>null</code>
122         * @return the passed in {@link StringBuilder}
123         * @see #execute(Object, StringBuilder)
124         */
125        public static StringBuilder render(Object model, StringBuilder a) {
126                return of().execute(model, a);
127        }
128
129        /**
130         * Executes the ServiceLoader instance of JStachio {@link #execute(Object)}.
131         * @param model the root context model. Never <code>null</code>.
132         * @return the rendered string.
133         * @see #execute(Object)
134         */
135        public static String render(Object model) {
136                return of().execute(model);
137        }
138
139        /**
140         * Gets the static singleton jstachio.
141         * @return the jstachio from {@link #setStatic(Supplier)}
142         * @throws NullPointerException if jstachio is not found
143         * @see #setStatic(Supplier)
144         */
145        public static JStachio of() {
146                JStachio jstachio = JStachioHolder.get();
147                if (jstachio == null) {
148                        throw new NullPointerException("JStachio not found. This is probably a classloading issue.");
149                }
150                return jstachio;
151        }
152
153        /**
154         * Gets default singleton ServiceLoader based jstachio.
155         * @return service loaded jstachio
156         */
157        public static JStachio defaults() {
158                return io.jstach.jstachio.spi.JStachioFactory.defaultJStachio();
159        }
160
161        /**
162         * Set the static singleton of JStachio.
163         * <p>
164         * Useful if you would like to avoid using the default ServiceLoader mechanism.
165         * @param jstachioProvider if null a NPE will be thrown.
166         * @apiNote the provider will be called on every call of {@link #of()} and thus to
167         * avoid constant recreation it is recommend the supplier be memoized/cached.
168         */
169        public static void setStatic(Supplier<JStachio> jstachioProvider) {
170                if (jstachioProvider == null) {
171                        throw new NullPointerException("JStachio provider cannot be null");
172                }
173                JStachioHolder.provider = jstachioProvider;
174        }
175
176}
177
178final class JStachioHolder {
179
180        static Supplier<JStachio> provider = JStachio::defaults;
181
182        static JStachio get() {
183                return provider.get();
184        }
185
186}
